answers.answer: how is ur BP?...U saiad pressure...so if u have too much CSF fluid u would need a special MRI called a CINE MRI to detect that.ct I believe pick up abnormalities, not sure what ur situation is.Have u been to the drs to discuss this or was this a note u recieved?...do u have the report?what does the dr feel is causing the pressure u described?

Hi,Your MRI findings are unremarkable except for the fact that there is one focal high intensity focus in the white matter.This can be due to a number of benign causes like chronic headache, migraine, diabetes, hypertension, smoking, alcoholism etc.Your symptoms of pressure in the head could be due to sinusitis, ear infections, and TMJ or Temporormandibular joint infection.Please relax if you had a brain tumor both CT scan and MRI would have been able to pick it up.

question: okey I had an MRI/mra done on 10/15/08 and the doctors said everything was fine, but I was reading the report myself and read          "there is a small focal area of increased signal intensity in the right parietal inner table of the calvarium with absence on fat suppressed imaging, coronal post infusion pulse sequence consistent with a lipoma."my doctor said that everything was narmal, but why does it say this?now I had an MRI done this week and the report said everything was normal......SOOOO do you think im going to be okey  there has been pressure in my head but the docs have been telling me everything is Fine would an mri be able to pick it up???   PLEASE HELP.....im scared  thank youi also had a ct scan would that pick up a tumor? does an MRI pick one up???
